events.event_name: Release of HCOB Spain Services PMI for January 2026
events.description: The publication of the Purchasing Managers' Index for Spain's services sector, showing a slowdown in growth.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Spain Services PMI fell to 53.5 in January 2026 from 57.1 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Spain Services PMI fell to 53.5 in January 2026 from December’s 12-month high of 57.1

facts.fact_text: The PMI reading of 53.5 was lower than the market expectation of 56.6.
Employment growth in the services sector reached its highest level since March of the previous year.

evidences.evidence_text: Employment growth remained strongly positive and picked up from December, reaching its highest level since last March.

facts.fact_text: Business sentiment reached a ten-month high in January.

evidences.evidence_text: Finally, business sentiment improved slightly, climbing to a ten-month high.

claims.claim_text: The January PMI reading indicates the weakest expansion in the services sector since August.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: The latest reading signaled the weakest pace of expansion in services activity since August

claims.claim_text: Despite the slowdown, the overall growth in the services sector remains solid.
Weaker demand from major European markets caused a decline in export sales.
claims.author: Firms

evidences.evidence_text: export sales declined for a second time in three months, with firms pointing to weaker demand from key European markets.

claims.claim_text: Input cost inflation remains high due to hardware costs and labor expenses.
claims.author: Companies

evidences.evidence_text: input cost inflation stayed elevated, with companies citing higher costs for computer hardware and components as well as rising labor expenses

evidence.evidence_text: The HCOB Spain Services PMI fell to 53.5... signaling the weakest pace of expansion in services activity since August
export sales declined... with firms pointing to weaker demand from key European markets.
input cost inflation stayed elevated, with companies citing... rising labor expenses
selling prices increased at the fastest pace in three months.
Employment growth remained strongly positive and picked up from December
